import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
import seaborn as sns
print('Setup Complete')
source.d94ec90c:
stock_file_path = '../input/aapl.us.txt'
stock_data_aapl = pd.read_csv(stock_file_path, index_col='Date', parse_dates=True)
stock_data_aapl.describe()

plt.title('apple stock price last 50 days')


sns.lineplot(data=stock_data_aapl.tail(50))

source.9280305f:
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 6))
plt.title('apple stock price last 100 days')

#plt.show()

sns.lineplot(data=stock_data_aapl['High'].tail(100), label="High")
sns.lineplot(data=stock_data_aapl["Low"].tail(100), label='Low')

plt.xlabel("Date")
plt.ylabel("Value($)")
sns.set_style("white")

source.f89a38f7:
This Kernal is partially to demonstrate different visualization techniques and also for my own reference on various functions in matplotlib and seaborn. I will come back to clean up and expand on this kernal over time

The dataset used for these excersices is from Huge Stock Dataset uploaded by Boris Marjanovic, a dataset that I am fond of for practicing analytical techniques
